title: Aung San Suu Kyi is back behind bars. But that won't stop Myanmar's pro-democracy movement
description: Global condemnation followed the jailing of Myanmar's ousted civilian leader Aung San Suu Kyi on Monday.

title: Actor Jussie Smollett found guilty on five counts related to 2019 hate crime hoax
description: A jury in Chicago has reached a verdict in the case of Jussie Smollett, the "Empire" actor who was charged with six felony counts of making false reports to police that he was a victim of a hate crime in January 2019.

title: Nicaragua ends relations with Taiwan in diplomatic victory for China
description: Nicaragua's government announced Thursday that it was breaking diplomatic relations with Taiwan.

title: Trump loses bid to shield White House records from Jan. 6 investigators
description: • Analysis: The 28 most ridiculous lines from Trump's interview with Hugh Hewitt

title: Dozens killed in Mexico road accident
description: At least 49 migrants were killed when a trailer collided with a truck and overturned in southern Mexico on Thursday, according to local authorities.

title: South Korea green-lights plans for 'floating city'
description: The South Korean city of Busan has green-lit plans for an ambitious new ocean settlement, with work on the first neighborhood set to begin next year.

title: Senator falsely claims mouthwash can kill Covid-19
description: During an interview with CNN's Erin Burnett, Gov. Chris Sununu (R-NH) denounces Sen. Ron Johnson's (R-WI) false claim that mouthwash has been proven to kill Covid-19.

title: CNN reporter chases down Wisconsin man leading election investigation
description: More than a year removed from the 2020 election, Trump loyalists are conducting the fourth review of Wisconsin's election results. CNN reporter Kyung Lah tried to track down the man in charge of this partisan review.

title: Uyghur tribunal rules that China 'committed genocide' against the Uyghurs and other ethnic minorities
description: A London-based independent tribunal has ruled that China committed genocide against Uyghurs and other ethnic minorities in its western Xinjiang region, accusing China's senior leadership including President Xi Jinping of "primary responsibility" for acts perpetrated against Muslim minority groups.

title: State Department officer struck by Havana syndrome sues Blinken and agency for alleged disability discrimination
description: A State Department officer who says he was struck by the strange constellation of symptoms now known as "Havana syndrome" in 2017 is suing Secretary of State Antony Blinken and the State Department for disability discrimination, according to court filings.

title: 'Rust' crew members say morale was high, deny allegations the set was 'chaotic, dangerous' in new letter
description: Members of the cast and crew of "Rust" released a letter on Thursday saying the descriptions of the film set as a "chaotic, dangerous, and exploitative workplace are false" and distract from the tragic death of director of photography Halyna Hutchins, 42, and the need to reform "outdated industry firearm and safety practices."

title: Family of student wounded in Michigan shooting sues for over $100 million
description: The family of a student who was shot during the Oxford High School shooting last week filed a lawsuit on Thursday against the school district, officials and employees that argues they "willfully misrepresented the dangers" of a potential shooting and acted recklessly.
